fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3781].
  {panel}

h2.Summary

Automation condition 'User is a customer' also triggers for agent users.

h2.Steps to Replicate
# Create a service desk automation that has 'User is a customer' IF condition. 
# Create a ticket and make sure the assignee and reporter is the an agent (your account).
# Trigger the automation created on first step.

h2.Expected Results
Automation is not triggered as expected because agents should not be able to trigger customer specific automation. There is a separate IF condition 'User is an agent' for agents.

h2.Current Results
Automation is triggered.

h2. Workaround
There are 2 conditions available. Decide what to use for your usecase
* User is a customer
* User is not an agent
Having it work as it is might be convenient in scenarios when agents might also be customers (when dealing with multiple SD projects and resolving teams).
fields.summary: Automation condition 'User is a customer' triggers for agents

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3780].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
The "Workload Report" doesn't refresh a username when the username changes. When I attempt to see the ticket breakdown by clicking on the bars on the right of a user, it uses the old username in the link, even though the bar appears correct

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Change the username of a Service Desk user.
# Access the *Workload* report and click on the bar under *Issue in progress*

h3. Expected Results
Redirected to the list of issues that are assigned to the user, unresolved, and part of the project.

h3. Actual Results
Getting no results found as the username used in the JQL is still the old username and not the new one.

h3.Workaround
* Changing the username to the original value makes it work again. (not preferred)
* Manually change the JQL results to the lower_user_name value in the query.
fields.summary: Workload report doesn't refresh if a user name changes

h3. Summary

When viewing JIRA Service Desk it is reporting as an invalid version and should be upgraded, despite being on 3.1.6 already.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Install JIRA Core 7.1.0.
# Browse to Versions & licenses.
# Upload the plugin manually from https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.servicedesk.application/versions (currently due to JSD-3774 it cannot be automatically updated).

h3. Expected Results

The error banner does not appear indicating to 'upgrade' to a downgraded version.

h3. Actual Results

The error 'JIRA Service Desk must be updated to version 3.1.4 to be compatible with the installed version of JIRA Core.', despite being on an upgraded version.

h3. Notes

This can be ignored as a spurious error, as 3.1.6 is compatible with JIRA 7.1.0 as per https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.servicedesk.application/versions.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3758].
  {panel}

    We would like our Service Desk customers to be able to see the Service Desk Queues so that they can see where their requests are compared to other requests.

    We don't necessarily want them to be able to see details of other requests, though it would be okay for them to see summary info for other requests, like Reporter, Assignee, and Summary.

    In the past we recreated the Queues by using filters, and embedded those in Confluence using the JIRA macro. However, that works only if the user accessing the Confluence page has Browse Projects permissions for the projects included in the filter. We don't want our customers to have that permission, since they would then be able to access all the information on all issues. We use Internal Comments on the issue to discuss solutions among support agents, and we don't want the customers to see that information.

    We are using JIRA Server 6.3.12 and ServiceDesk v2.3.6
fields.summary: Provide functionality to show Service Desk Queues to customers

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3751].
  {panel}

h2. What is the problem?
Users who are logged in to Service Desk are able to see KB search results through the Customer Portal, but are forced to log in to Confluence to see the full article.
This is counterintuitive to customers because they feel that if they can see the search results they are already authenticated.
Once customers sign in once with their credentials they are able to view articles.

h2. Who experiences this problem?
This problem exists only in Server (Server/Server or Server/Cloud - if that is a thing).
One of the reporting customers is using JIRA User Directory for their shared user base which does not support SSO.
This is not a problem for Cloud/Cloud instances as they have a shared user base and SSO.
This is also not a problem if the customer is using Crowd and the JSD and Confluence instances have the same domain as this supports SSO.

h2. Why does this happen?
Searching and viewing use different auth contexts.
Search uses impersonation to fetch and return the search results from a Confluence endpoint.
This requires impersonation to be setup through the Applinks which is what the customer has done.
Viewing an article renders an iframe in the page from the Confluence domain which is why it requires further authentication (to get a Confluence session ID).

h2. How do we solve it?
Remove the redirection to Confluence by bringing the login prompt into Service Desk in the modal dialog which currently links to Confluence.
fields.summary: Move Confluence Login Prompt into Service Desk Modal Dialog

h3. Summary:
When creating a new custom report in JSD using the time metrics Breached and Met, the report shows a graphic based on the number of tickets but if you use the export csv feature, the exported file will display a time value (probably the SLA) that is 00:00 instead of the number of tickets.

h3. Steps to Reproduce:
# Select Reports on the left menu in a Service Desk Project.
# Under Custom, select New Report.
# Provide a name to the New Report.
# Select Add Series > Select in Series the option Breached > Provide a name in label > Select Add.
# Select Add Series > Select in Series the option Met > Provide a name in label > Select Add.
# Select Create.
# Select Export CSV.

h3. Expected Result:
The exported file should show a integer value related to the number of tickets.

h3. Actual Result:
The exported file shows a time value that is 00:00.
fields.summary: Export CSV feature broken when using in JSD Custom Time Metric Reports.

h3. Summary

If the current assignee of a JIRA Service Desk issue does not have Assignable permissions, Customers cannot be added to the Participants field through the Customer Portal.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a request in a SD
# Assign it to a user, use "agent"
# Go to user and roles and remove "agent" as a service desk team member
# Try to add any user as a request participant

h3. Expected Results

* Request participant added.
* Assignee field should fail on its own and not blow up another field.

h3. Actual Results

The error "Failed to update participants field, errors: " occurs and the field is not updated as per the attached screenshot.

h3. Workaround

Provide the assignee with the correct permissions. They may need to be unassigned / reassigned the issue for this to work.

h3. Notes

This issue should be reproducible by making any other field fail to update while trying to add request participants, the steps above are just the way it was discovered in a support case.

Hello,

At this time, users that are Customers (as in, they do not consume a user license but can open issues) cannot view issues that they haven't reporter or haven't been added as watcher. This is a limitation of the customer portal. In order for users to be able to view issues, they would need to have a JIRA license. 

For my case, I would like be able to grant some of the customers the ability to search for issues through either the main interface (navigator), through the portal or something completely different. 

A lot of times, organizations have different categories: For us, we have internal customers who require to search for tickets, but not work on them (such as closing, transitioning, commenting etc). Our external customers are absolutely fine with having only access to tickets they own.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3714].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When searching in Customer Portal, modifying/deleting a previous keyword does not auto populate search results. 

h3. Environment
* Issue occurs in Firefox, Safari and Chrome, though the replication steps are slightly different. The issue is most obvious in Chrome. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a JSD project
# Link a Confluence space to the project in project settings and make sure customers can access space/project.
# Visit the customer portal page to your project and type in a search word. Notice that as you type, there is a spinning circle to indicate that the system is searching.
# Once the search results auto populate, backspace to delete the word.
# Begin typing in a new search word. If the search auto populates, complete steps 3-5 again, until you find that nothing populates or happens when you type in search words. 

h3. Expected Results
When typing in a search word in the customer portal, articles should auto populate or a message saying “No solutions found.” should appear (if nothing matches the search). The below screenshot shows an example of a search for a keyword that does not exist in the KB:
!search_expected.png|thumbnail!
If I delete the word *MacBook*, and try typing in a new search term, the portal should begin to auto populate responses to my new search term. 
 
h3. Actual Results
The first search works, however if you delete and try typing in a new word, nothing will populate. An example of this can be seen in the following screenshot:
!search_actual.png|thumbnail!

Depending upon which browser you’re using, you may need to delete and re-add keywords multiple times to replicate. In Chrome it happens typically after one time. In Safari and Firefox it can take up to 4 or 5 times of typing in a keyword, deleting, and adding a new word. 
Nothing is apparent in the logs, aside from the following:
{noformat}
2016-04-26 20:05:36.501498500 2016-04-26 20:05:36,501 JIRA-EventThread-271 WARN rfuerst 1205x12718x1 1ekp03u 4.15.43.214 /servicedesk/customer/portal/2 [c.a.workcontext.api.WorkContextManager] Created WorkContext leniently (see: go/work-context-lenient-mode-errors) thread: JIRA-EventThread-271
2016-04-26 20:05:37.419404500 2016-04-26 20:05:37,419 JIRA-EventThread-273 WARN rfuerst 1205x12718x1 1ekp03u 4.15.43.214 /servicedesk/customer/portal/2 [c.a.workcontext.api.WorkContextManager] Created WorkContext leniently (see: go/work-context-lenient-mode-errors) thread
{noformat}

Development console does not show anything either:
!dev_console.png|thumbnail!

h3.Workaround
The current workaround is to completely reload the customer portal page and re-initiate a search.
fields.summary: Search function on customer portal page intermittently does not auto populate

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3709].
  {panel}

h2. Problem statement
Service Desk currently allows Agents to create requests on behalf of customers.
These issues are treated as if they have been created by the customer, and generate a notification that indicates this. This can create confusion on what the source of an issue has been, as there currently is no way for a customer to see the difference between issues created by them, or on their behalf. Only Agents are capable to see the difference, for which they have to check the History tab of the issue in JIRA (not Service Desk)

h2. Suggestion
Whenever an agent creates an issue on behalf of another user, send out a notification that reflects this, instead of using the current create request notification. This way, a customer can see the difference between issues created by themself, and those created on their behalf.
fields.summary: Send a separate notification when an Agent creates an issue on behalf of a customer

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3708].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently it is possible to create two different mail handlers for JIRA SD
# *JIRA Service Desk Project Administration > Email requests* (hereby refered to as _SD mail handler_)
# *JIRA Administration > System > Incoming Mail* and assign to a Service Desk project (hereby refered to as _non-SD mail handler_)

This causes problem/confusion to many JIRA Administrators during troubleshooting because some are not aware of this change or its implication since JIRA 7: [Why do users need application access to create issues in JIRA 7?|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/31663613/why-do-users-need-application-access-to-create-issues-in-jira-7]

Some JIRA Administrators will attempt to create a _non-SD mail handler_ for the SD project in *JIRA Administration > System > Incoming Mail* and discover that the mail handler fails to generate the issue from their customer's email. This is due to the reasons explained in the link above (SD customers do not have application access). They are not aware that only the _SD mail handler_ will allow the creation of issues from the email of users without application access.

h3. Suggested Solution
# Prevent a _non-SD mail handler_ from being assigned to a Service Desk project
# When JIRA Administrators clicks on "Add Incoming Mail Handler" in *JIRA Administration > System > Incoming Mail*, display a list of projects.Depending on the selected project, (SD or non-SD project) create the appropriate mail handler
# Alternatively, force the creation of Service Desk mail handler in *JIRA Service Desk Project Administration > Email requests* only, but display it as read-only in *JIRA Administration > System > Incoming Mail*

h3. Workaround 
N/A
fields.summary: JIRA Service Desk and JIRA Core/Software Mail Handler needs to be separated/clearly defined

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3701].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently it is not possible to set resolution using Service Desk automation

h3. Suggested Solution
Add the functionality to automate resolution when is condition is met
 
h3. Workaround 
This should be possible using JIRA Automation add-on: https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.plugin.automation.jira-automation-plugin/server/overview. The following guide will help you configure JIRA automation add-on to achive this: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Using+JIRA+Automation+Plugin+to+close+an+Issue+will+result+in+an+unresolved+closed+issue

h3. Summary
Missing options when configuring JIRA Service Desk Knowledge Base integration with Confluence.

It affects JIRA 7.1.1 and Confluence 5.8.14 integration.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install JIRA 7.1.1 with Service Desk 3.1.1
# Install Confluence 5.8.14
# Create an application link between JIRA and Confluence with oAuth 2L and user impersonation enabled.
# Link a Confluence Space with a Service Desk project knowledge base in JIRA.

h3. Expected Results
To be able to view the missing configuration options (in red) as per screenshot below: 

 !missing option.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
A message asking to upgrade Confluence is displayed instead showing the configuration options.

 !missing option2.png|thumbnail! 

We also get the following entry logged in JIRA log:

{noformat}
2016-04-21 15:51:18,033 http-nio-8880-exec-16 WARN admin 951x1199x1 1xk1vv 192.168.10.122 /rest/servicedesk/1/knowledgebase/permissions/TEST [c.a.s.internal.applink.BaseAppLinkResponseHandlerImpl] Confluence KB plugin present but the endpoint is not. Check that the Confluence Knowledge Base plugin is at least version 2.0.5.
{noformat}

h3. Notes
This was working properly on JIRA Service Desk 2.5 with Confluence 5.8.14 and there is nothing on the online documentation [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SERVICEDESKSERVER031/Serving+customers+with+a+knowledge+base] to address the version incompatibility.

h3. Workaround

Upgrade Confluence to version 5.9.x
fields.summary: Missing options when configuring JIRA Service Desk Knowledge Base integration with Confluence.
Email Request 'Connectivity Log' showing all error messages, not just the one account

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3682].
  {panel}

Basically for SLA events there's a "timed promise" added into a table in the database that tells Service Desk at what point in the future it should fire. The issue is that we're calculating that future value incorrectly, so although the SLA is working fine, automation events that should be triggered when the SLA event happens aren't.

If you change the issue that does not affect the SLA start/pause/stop AFTER the SLA has started, it will reset the target time for the automation when handler to the full SLA goal time (minus the 60 minutes, as the first event is fired 60 min before breach)
and for issues that drag on and drag on (i.e. lots of updates) it never will.

The following query can be used for find out about SLA's time promise for future

{code:sql}
SELECT
    t."ID",
    (p.pkey || '-' ||  i.issuenum) AS issue,
    t."CLASSIFICATION",
    t."STATUS",
    TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE 'epoch' + (t."CREATED_TIME_MILLIS"/1000) * INTERVAL '1 second' AS created_time,
    TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE 'epoch' + (t."UPDATED_TIME_MILLIS"/1000) * INTERVAL '1 second' AS updated_time,
    TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE 'epoch' + (t."TARGET_TIME_MILLIS"/1000)  * INTERVAL '1 second' AS target_time
FROM
    "AO_F1B27B_KEY_COMPONENT" c
LEFT JOIN
    "AO_F1B27B_PROMISE" t ON t."ID" = c."TIMED_PROMISE_ID"
LEFT JOIN
    jiraissue i ON i.id = c."VALUE"::int
LEFT JOIN
    project p ON p.id = i.project
ORDER BY t."ID" ASC;
{code}

*How to reproduce*
- Create any SLA
- Create an issue
- Keep updating that issue and see SLA's time promise "target_time" updated incorrectly
fields.summary: SLA's time promise is not scheduled correctly after updating

*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3669].
{panel}
{panel:title=Update from Atlassian Product team}
Thank you all for your votes and feedback on this issue. This is the smaller of two issues about the same topic, and has been closed to direct the discussion to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-868

That issue in currently _Under Consideration_ and being evaluated for prioritisation. We would love to hear from you over there.
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

In certain cases, Service Desks need to be restricted to a set of customers belonging to one and the same organisation.
 Public signup does not provide a proper means to prevent incorrect customer accounts not belonging to that organisation from being created.

The only alternative available right now, is to disable public signup, which has as a result that the Service Desk administrator can get presented with significant amounts of work solely for account creation.
h3. Suggested Solution

As such, being able to define an email domain as requirement for public signup, can provide a small degree of safety, while at the same time prevent a lot of overhead for the administrators.

For instance, if a Service Desk has public signup enabled, and an email domain has been defined, the Service Desk will only allow account creation if the source address conforms to the defined domain.
fields.summary: Allow email domain restrictions for public signup

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

h3. Summary

System is not allowing send an invitation for customers to the portal that have a single character between dots on their email address.

For example:
joel.e.ramos@gmail.com
diego.t.oliveira@gmail.com

Note that the letter ‘e’ is between two dots. We have tested many emails and the system does not allow it.

h3. Environment

JIRA - 7.2.0-OD-05-030

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Service Desk Project
# Go to the ‘Customers’
# Click on ‘Invite customers’
# Type on email like: joel.e.ramos@gmail.com
# Click ‘Send invites’

# Step 2

h3. Expected Results

The system should send the invitation.

h3. Actual Results
This is the log error:

{code}
2016-04-12 14:08:35.013432500 Apr 12, 2016 2:08:35 PM com.sun.jersey.spi.container.servlet.WebComponent filterFormParameters
2016-04-12 14:08:35.013433500 WARNING: A servlet request, to the URI https://manentia.atlassian.net/rest/servicedesk/1/customer/pages/portal/26/user/login, contains form parameters in the request body but the request body has been consumed by the servlet or a servlet filter accessing the request parameters. Only resource methods using @FormParam will work as expected. Resource methods consuming the request body by other means will not work as expected.
{code}

This is the error message: *email* is not a valid email address.

h3.Workaround
# Create the user on the system with ‘Restricted Portal access’.
# Add him later to the Service Desk Customers on the ‘Users and Roles’ of the project.
fields.summary: System is not allowing send an invitation for customers to the portal

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

*Trigger:* The reporter of an issue replies to the Satisfaction Survey email.
*Causes:* The satisfaction survey is included as a comment to the issue, together with the score links and token.
*Result:* Anyone with access to the issue can set the customer's satisfaction score by copy-pasting the desired URL.

The trigger will only work if the reporter's email account is set to include the previous email in the reply.

*Suggested fix:* Filter the email replies included as comments to erase the links matching the structure of a satisfaction link.

*Notes*
Forwarding the notification mail that includes the survey request to another user can also cause that other user to follow the score links, effectively overwriting the previous value.

!reply.jpg!
fields.summary: Satisfaction survey added as a comment lets anyone set the score

h3. Problem Definition

In our setup of JSD: the reported issues have both a reporter (the customer usually), and one or several participants (the customers customers). And we use the comments feature to send information to each other in order to clarify/find out what to do.
Since you could add participants and remove participants along the way, it´s difficult to see in the GUI to whom the notifications has been sent to or not. So in some cases it ends up with (our customer usually) adding a new comment, and @:ing all participants again just to be sure.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add a notification information to the comment itself and / or a notification menu. As this will somewhat demystify the notifications sent.
Example shown as below:
 !2016-04-06 new_picture.png|thumbnail!

h3. Summary
When the mail puller encounters an message in the mail channel mailbox originating from an invalid formatted "From" field, the mail puller will not be able to process that message, and continuously loop on this message, effectively rendering the mail pulling process broken. A correctly formatted looks like "name@domain.extension".
A known source for this issue is Microsoft Outlook 365, where certain messages originate from "Microsoft Outlook" opposed to a valid email address in the "From" field.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Ensure the mailbox configured as mail channel in a Service Desk project contains an email originating from a source which does not provide a valid formatted email address in the "From" field as described in the summary
# Have the mail puller pull and process the email automatically

h3. Expected Results
The mail gets pulled into the database.
In this case, it is not relevant for the email to get processed further beyond this point.
Once the email has been pulled, the mail puller should continue to pull mails from the mail box.

h3. Actual Results
The mail puller gets stuck on the incorrect email and will continuously loop on it, instead of moving on to the next mail in the mailbox.
The atlassian-jira-incoming-mail.log file will display the following error for each attempt to pull the mail in question:
{code}
Unable to create issue with message.
javax.mail.internet.AddressException: Local address contains control or whitespace in string ``Microsoft Outlook''
{code} 

h3. Notes
The relevant message in Microsoft Outlook is an automatically generated one to inform the user of certain changes on the mail platform, or the welcoming message when starting to use the product for the first time. So far, no other mail providers are known to cause similar issues.

h3.Workaround
Delete the offending message from the mail box. This will allow the mail puller to proceed from that point onwards.
fields.summary: Emails from an invalid formatted "From" address will stop the mail puller

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3624].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently , during project creation , JIRA Service Desk will automatically create new scheme for the project . Which is kindda hassle for user if they already have associated schema for the project . They may need to remove unneccassary new scheme.

h3. Suggested Solution
Give option during project creation .
fields.summary: During Project creation , have option to create or not for new Permission/Workflow/Screen scheme

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3623].
  {panel}

h4. Suggestion
Currently, when knowledge base articles are displayed in the help center, only the actual content is present and no additional fields can be selected. In certain circumstances, administrators may want to display the author of an article, so that users can reach out to them, or simply making it more personal. In some cases, the creation and/or modification date of the article also yields information of how recent and actual the article may be.

h4. Proposed solution
Make the layout of knowledge base articles in the help center and the displayed fields configurable, preferably from the administration UI.
fields.summary: Customize layout and fields on displayed knowledge base articles
Set a minimum for number of service desks before portal displays "Browse all"

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3619].
  {panel}

h3. Expected Behavior

Properly handle timezone corrections, such as DST start and end, not instantiating invalid timezones.
h3. Actual Behavior

Working Hours tried to instantiate the time 2016-03-13 07:00:00 UTC which, upon the start of DST in NY (2 AM NY time, going directly to 3 AM), is invalid.

This will throw a 500 error on the browser upon accessing the "Queues" view of Service Desk or, on the SLA panel, display a blank page. In both cases, the stack trace thrown is the below.

h3. Workaround

Change the SLA calendar to use the GMT offset correspondent to the current timezone after DST correction. For example, in NY use GMT-4.

However, since it's not possible to access any SLA configuration panel upon the occurrence of this problem, you can use the below query to update this option on JIRA's database. Replace {{America/New York}} and {{Etc/GMT+4}} accordingly.

(i) _Since Java uses POSIX-style timezones, the '+n' stands for n hours before GMT, whereas '-n' stands for n hours ahead of GMT._
{code:sql}
UPDATE "AO_7A2604_CALENDAR" SET "TIMEZONE" = 'Etc/GMT+4' WHERE "TIMEZONE" = "America/New York"
{code}

The articles from https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/serving-customers-with-a-knowledge-base-732528995.html is misleading users , and there are not sufficient guide/steps on configuring this. As this will need further configuration on Confluence side to ensure that the functionality "Allow all active service desk users and customers" to works properly. This has lead to creation of bug ticket created in JAC due to the confusion that occurs:
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSD-3448

 !Selection_117.png|thumbnail! 
*_If you choose to restrict viewing of the linked Confluence space to licensed users, you must grant customers a Confluence license or open your Confluence space to anonymous access._*

Which I have broken down to below:

If you choose to restrict viewing of the linked Confluence space to licensed users, you must grant customers a Confluence license (this is correct)
If you choose to restrict viewing of the linked Confluence space to licensed users, you must open your Confluence space to anonymous access ( this is not correct, why would you want to open Confluence space to anonymous access if you would like to restrict it?)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3615].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
If an attachment gets added to a customer request, which has an identical name to another attachment under the same request, all existing references to the original attachment will get adjusted to reflect the new attachment.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# As a customer, add an attachment to a request. From the customer view, this issue will have a linked url displayed as {{<baseurl>/servicedesk/customershim/secure/attachment/<attachmentID1>/<attachmentID1>_<attachmentname>}}
# As an Agent, add an attachment to the same request, and choose "Add to issue only". The file name should be identical to the file as attached under step 1. This attachment is not visible from the customer view

h3. Expected Results
The attachment added by the customer should remain being displayed as {{<baseurl>/servicedesk/customershim/secure/attachment/<attachmentID1>/<attachmentID1>_<attachmentname>}} and be accessible as such.

h3. Actual Results
The url referencing the attachment in the customer view has changed to {{<baseurl>/servicedesk/customershim/secure/attachment/<attachmentID2>/<attachmentID2>_<attachmentname>}}

h3. Notes
For the above setup, the files do not have to be identical, just the file name needs to be identical. This has been tested with both identical files, as well as with different files renamed to have identical names.
fields.summary: Adding an attachment with an identical file name will change all existing references in a request

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3614].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
If an Agent adds an attachment to a customer request, and chooses "Add to issue only" instead of "Share with the customer", the attachment in question will not be visible to the customer.
However, the customer *is* capable of downloading the file if it has the direct url to the attachment.
For instance, a direct url to an attachment is as follows:
{code}
<baseurl>/servicedesk/customershim/secure/attachment/10102/10102_<attachmentname>
{code}

Changing the {{/10102/}} segment to any other ID allows for the customer to download the attachment matching that ID. The last segment of the url is not relevant, so it is not required to know the exact file name in order to download the file.

(!) This only works for attachments which are placed under an issue to which the customer in question has access. Attachments located under issues to which the customer does not have access, can *not* be downloaded by the customer. However, it *is* possible for the customer to download files which have been hidden using the attaching method as described above. Whether or not these attachments should be accessible for the customer is currently not certain.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a request as a customer
# Add an attachment to the request as customer
# Add an attachment to the request as Agent, and choose "Add to issue only"
# As customer, copy the link to the attachment added it added, and increase the ID by 1

h3. Expected Results
Since the attachment added by the Agent is not visible from the customer view, it should not be accessible for the customer

h3. Actual Results
After inserting the adjusted url, the customer gets prompted with a download dialogue.

h3. Notes
Attachment ID increase by 1 each time one gets added to the instance. The above reproduction steps only work when between the customer and the agent adding an attachment, no other attachments have been added which are not accessible by the customer.
fields.summary: Internal attachments can be downloaded by customers
